title: Sunny Skylar
text:
Sunny Skylar (October 11, 1913 – February 2, 2009) was an American <a href="composer">composer</a>, <a href="singing">singer</a>, <a href="lyrics">lyricist</a>, and music publisher. He was born Selig Shaftel in <a href="Brooklyn%2C%20New%20York">Brooklyn, New York</a>. As a singer, he appeared with a number of <a href="big%20band">big band</a>s, including those led by <a href="Ben%20Bernie">Ben Bernie</a>, <a href="Paul%20Whiteman">Paul Whiteman</a>, <a href="Abe%20Lyman">Abe Lyman</a>, George Hall and <a href="Vincent%20Lopez">Vincent Lopez</a>. It was Lopez who changed the singer's professional name from Sonny Schuyler to Sunny Skylar. After the end of the big band era, Skylar continued to sing in <a href="nightclub">nightclub</a>s and <a href="theater">theater</a>s until <a href="1952%20in%20music">1952</a>.
